page.title: 04HOUSING IN ABERDYFI
page.content: The present village comprises mainly of Edwardian and Victorian terraced houses.Outwardly they retain their original character but with the resident population declining from 1358 in 1901 to approximately 800 in 1985 many have been converted into holiday homes. Recent building has been confined to the small scale development of holiday properties set in the steep hillside behind the village. Aberdyfi survives as a holiday resort with a booming property market. An elderly resident suggested that for the village to continue to 'live' as a community then realistically priced housing for the indiginous population had to be made available.
